snippet: Federal prosecutors say the correspondence reveals “powerful direct proof” of Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai’s “knowing and intentional participation” in Al Qaeda’s conspiracies to bomb and kill Americans.
abstract: Federal prosecutors seek to introduce correspondence between Osama Bin Laden and Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai at latter's terrorism trial in Manhattan; contend letters reveal Ruqai's intentional participation in Al Qaeda conspiracies to bomb and kill Americans.
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors say the correspondence reveals “powerful direct proof” of Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai’s “knowing and intentional participation” in Al Qaeda’s conspiracies to bomb and kill Americans.

headline.main: U.S. Seeks to Use Letters Found in Bin Laden Raid in Terrorism Trial
headline.print_headline: Federal Prosecutors Seek to Introduce Letters to Bin Laden at Terrorism Trial
